prompt:
Create 4 prompts for a cohesive, chronologically flowing Thank you - AI for Good Conference greeting card that tells a visual story (9:16 ratio):

ðŸŽ¨ CREATIVITY MANDATE: Be genuinely creative, unique, and innovative! Avoid generic or clichÃ© designs. Think outside the box, surprise with unexpected elements, use bold artistic choices, and create something truly memorable and special. Push creative boundaries while staying appropriate for the card type and tone.

Theme: "Create a card saying thank you for attending AI for Good Conference at Stanford, CA June 2025. thank them for helping prosper this conversation. Include her name prominenetly in the front but dont include any people. can you subtely include the reference image papersaurus with his printer"
Style: âœ¨ Smart Style
Tone: ðŸ˜„ Funny - humorous and lighthearted
To: Jessica Greenwalt

Message: "Jessica Greenwalt, thank you so much for attending the AI for Good Conference! Your presence helped make the conversation about as epic as a paper-craft dinosaur successfully operating a printer. We hope you left inspired and with slightly fewer paper jams in your life!"

Reference: "artistic transformation"

CRITICAL: Create a cohesive visual narrative that flows chronologically through the card experience:
1. FRONT COVER: First impression - sets the scene/introduces the story
2. INTERIOR SPREAD: The heart of the experience - continuation and climax of the visual story
3. BACK COVER: Conclusion - peaceful resolution or complementary ending

Requirements:
- Flat 2D artwork for printing (not 3D card images)
- Full-bleed backgrounds extending to edges
- IMPORTANT: Keep text, faces, and key elements at least 10% away from top/bottom edges (small amount may be cropped in printing)
- Keep text/faces 0.5" from left/right edges for safe printing
- CONSISTENT visual elements throughout: same characters, color palette, lighting, art style
- Progressive visual storytelling from front â†’ interior â†’ back
- Put any text in quotes and make it clear/readable
- Each section should feel like part of the same artistic universe
- TONE: Ensure the visual mood and atmosphere matches the humorous and lighthearted tone throughout all sections
- INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY SAFETY: If the user mentions specific characters, brands, logos, or products, automatically replace them with original generic alternatives in your prompts. For example: replace specific character names with "cartoon mouse character" or "superhero character", replace brand names with "colorful cereal" or "sports car", etc. Create inspired-by designs that capture the essence without referencing any protected names or specific copyrighted elements. Never include actual brand names, character names, or trademarked terms in the image generation prompts
- CONTENT SAFETY: Ensure all prompts are family-friendly and appropriate for greeting cards. Avoid any content that could be flagged by safety systems including: violence, weapons, inappropriate imagery, political content, controversial topics, scary or disturbing elements, or anything not suitable for all ages. If the user requests something potentially inappropriate, redirect to positive, wholesome alternatives that capture their intent in a family-friendly way
- Include visual humor, playful elements, and whimsical details





- Create cartoon/illustrated characters inspired by reference image - DO NOT make realistic depictions

Create prompts that flow chronologically:

1. Front Cover (Opening Scene): BE GENUINELY CREATIVE AND UNIQUE! Include "Thank you - AI for Good Conference" greeting text positioned safely in the center area (avoid top/bottom 10% of image). I have included my own reference image. Create a stylized cartoon/illustrated character inspired by the reference image - DO NOT make realistic depictions of real people, instead create charming cartoon-style characters with simplified, friendly features. This is the story opening - introduce key visual elements (colors, motifs, artistic style) that will continue throughout the other sections. Think of something unexpected, innovative, and memorable that will surprise and delight the recipient. Avoid generic designs! Style: in a warm and inviting storybook watercolor illustration style. The scene is bathed in the soft, golden light of a California afternoon, evoking a feeling of optimism and gentle warmth. The Stanford campus is depicted with soft, flowing washes of earthy greens, warm terracotta, and sun-drenched ochre, creating a dreamy, painterly backdrop rather than a literal representation. Front and center, subtly nestled amongst charmingly rendered trees and blooming flowers, is our friendly "papersaurus" character, crafted from folded paper textures and brought to life with delicate, whimsical watercolor details. He is playfully tending to his small, antique-style letterpress printer, from which a continuous scroll of paper flows, symbolizing the ongoing, fruitful conversation. The name "Jessica Greenwalt" is elegantly hand-lettered in a beautiful, flowing calligraphy script, rendered in a rich, warm sepia ink that feels both personal and distinguished. The entire composition has a handmade, artisanal feel, full of heart and artistic spirit, as if painted with genuine appreciation.

2. Left Interior (Story Development): UNLEASH YOUR CREATIVITY! You have complete creative freedom to design whatever you want for this left interior page! This is your artistic playground - create something genuinely innovative and unexpected that feels right for a Thank you - AI for Good Conference card with humorous and lighthearted tone. You can include: scenes, landscapes, objects, patterns, quotes, text, illustrations, realistic art, abstract art, or anything else that inspires you - but NO PEOPLE or characters unless the user specifically mentioned wanting people in their card description. Position any text safely in center area (avoid top/bottom 10%). Think of something no one has done before! Surprise us with bold, imaginative, and memorable artistic choices while maintaining visual harmony with the overall card style and tone. Style: in a warm and inviting storybook watercolor illustration style. The scene is bathed in the soft, golden light of a California afternoon, evoking a feeling of optimism and gentle warmth. The Stanford campus is depicted with soft, flowing washes of earthy greens, warm terracotta, and sun-drenched ochre, creating a dreamy, painterly backdrop rather than a literal representation. Front and center, subtly nestled amongst charmingly rendered trees and blooming flowers, is our friendly "papersaurus" character, crafted from folded paper textures and brought to life with delicate, whimsical watercolor details. He is playfully tending to his small, antique-style letterpress printer, from which a continuous scroll of paper flows, symbolizing the ongoing, fruitful conversation. The name "Jessica Greenwalt" is elegantly hand-lettered in a beautiful, flowing calligraphy script, rendered in a rich, warm sepia ink that feels both personal and distinguished. The entire composition has a handmade, artisanal feel, full of heart and artistic spirit, as if painted with genuine appreciation.

3. Right Interior (Story Climax): BE CREATIVE WITH MESSAGE DESIGN! Include message text: "Jessica Greenwalt, thank you so much for attending the AI for Good Conference! Your presence helped make the conversation about as epic as a paper-craft dinosaur successfully operating a printer. We hope you left inspired and with slightly fewer paper jams in your life!" positioned safely in center area (avoid top/bottom 10% of image) integrated into beautiful, innovative decorative artwork. Think beyond typical florals and patterns - create something unexpected and artistic that perfectly frames the message - NO PEOPLE or characters. This should feel like the emotional peak of the card experience, harmonizing with the left interior as a cohesive spread. Avoid clichÃ© designs and create something genuinely special! Style: in a warm and inviting storybook watercolor illustration style. The scene is bathed in the soft, golden light of a California afternoon, evoking a feeling of optimism and gentle warmth. The Stanford campus is depicted with soft, flowing washes of earthy greens, warm terracotta, and sun-drenched ochre, creating a dreamy, painterly backdrop rather than a literal representation. Front and center, subtly nestled amongst charmingly rendered trees and blooming flowers, is our friendly "papersaurus" character, crafted from folded paper textures and brought to life with delicate, whimsical watercolor details. He is playfully tending to his small, antique-style letterpress printer, from which a continuous scroll of paper flows, symbolizing the ongoing, fruitful conversation. The name "Jessica Greenwalt" is elegantly hand-lettered in a beautiful, flowing calligraphy script, rendered in a rich, warm sepia ink that feels both personal and distinguished. The entire composition has a handmade, artisanal feel, full of heart and artistic spirit, as if painted with genuine appreciation.

4. Back Cover (Story Resolution): BE SUBTLY CREATIVE! Create a simple yet innovative decorative design that brings peaceful closure to the visual story. Reference subtle elements from the front cover but keep it minimal and serene - NO TEXT and NO PEOPLE, just beautiful, unexpected artistic elements that go beyond typical patterns or florals. Think of something quietly beautiful and memorable that complements the overall design while being genuinely unique. This should feel like a peaceful, artistic ending that surprises with its subtle creativity. Style: in a warm and inviting storybook watercolor illustration style. The scene is bathed in the soft, golden light of a California afternoon, evoking a feeling of optimism and gentle warmth. The Stanford campus is depicted with soft, flowing washes of earthy greens, warm terracotta, and sun-drenched ochre, creating a dreamy, painterly backdrop rather than a literal representation. Front and center, subtly nestled amongst charmingly rendered trees and blooming flowers, is our friendly "papersaurus" character, crafted from folded paper textures and brought to life with delicate, whimsical watercolor details. He is playfully tending to his small, antique-style letterpress printer, from which a continuous scroll of paper flows, symbolizing the ongoing, fruitful conversation. The name "Jessica Greenwalt" is elegantly hand-lettered in a beautiful, flowing calligraphy script, rendered in a rich, warm sepia ink that feels both personal and distinguished. The entire composition has a handmade, artisanal feel, full of heart and artistic spirit, as if painted with genuine appreciation.

VISUAL CONTINUITY CHECKLIST:
- Same color palette across all sections
- Consistent lighting/time of day
- Same artistic techniques and brushwork
- Recurring visual motifs or symbols (but make them unique and memorable!)
- Progressive emotional journey from introduction to resolution
- Front cover: stylized cartoon/illustrated characters if people are needed for the theme
- Left interior: CREATIVE FREEDOM but NO PEOPLE unless user specifically requested people in their description
- Right interior: focus on message space with innovative decorative elements (NO PEOPLE)
- Back cover: simple yet creative decorative design without text or people
- Use simplified, friendly, charming character design if including people (front cover only)
- CREATIVITY PRIORITY: Always choose the more innovative, surprising, and memorable option over generic designs

Return JSON:
{
  "frontCover": "detailed prompt with story opening elements",
  "backCover": "detailed prompt with story conclusion elements",
  "leftInterior": "detailed prompt with story development elements",
  "rightInterior": "detailed prompt with story climax elements"
}

IMPORTANT: Create a completely unique and different interpretation for this specific card variant. Use different creative approaches, color schemes, compositions, and artistic elements while maintaining the same core theme and requirements.

generatedPrompts.frontCover: Front cover of a greeting card with a warm, inviting storybook watercolor illustration style. The scene is bathed in the soft, golden light of a California afternoon, evoking a feeling of optimism and gentle warmth. The background depicts a stylized representation of the Stanford campus with soft, flowing washes of earthy greens, warm terracotta, and sun-drenched ochre, creating a dreamy, painterly backdrop. Prominently displayed in the upper center is the name "Jessica Greenwalt" in elegant, flowing calligraphy script, rendered in rich, warm sepia ink. Above the name is a whimsical, abstract swirl of thin, ink-like lines in a light brown hue. To the left, a charming cartoon character resembling a folded paper object with a worried expression stands near a small, antique-style letterpress printer. The printer is actively printing a sheet of paper with a simple cartoon dinosaur illustration. To the right, two friendly, green cartoon dinosaur characters are depicted. The larger dinosaur, with reddish-brown hair, holds a small framed picture of a cartoon dinosaur. The smaller dinosaur stands beside her, also with a happy expression. The overall composition has a handmade, artisanal feel, full of heart and artistic spirit, with the text "Thank you - AI for Good Conference" positioned in a clear, readable manner below the name, integrated into the scene. The art style is flat 2D, suitable for printing, with full-bleed backgrounds.
generatedPrompts.backCover: Back cover design for a greeting card with a watercolor illustration style, evoking the soft, golden light of a California afternoon. The scene is a grassy field in front of a building with trees, rendered in washes of earthy greens, warm terracotta, and sun-drenched ochre, creating a dreamy, painterly backdrop. In the foreground, a single, slightly crumpled white paper airplane rests on the grass, with a few scattered pieces of paper around it. The overall impression is serene and peaceful, offering a subtle resolution to the visual narrative of the card. There is no text or QR code present. The composition is minimalist, focusing on the quiet aftermath of a journey or idea, complementing the previous panels without being explicit.
generatedPrompts.leftInterior: Left interior page of a greeting card with a "Smart Style" watercolor illustration. The scene continues the humorous and lighthearted narrative. A cheerful, slightly exasperated green cartoon dinosaur, depicted with whimsical, soft watercolor textures, is entangled in a large, flowing scroll of paper. The paper is coming from a small, gray, retro-style printer that is actively printing. The background is a warm, golden-orange wash, reminiscent of a California sunset, with subtle, abstract swirling shapes in a lighter orange and yellow. The overall composition is dynamic, with the paper scroll creating a sense of movement and playful chaos around the dinosaur. The artistic style is consistent with the front cover, featuring soft edges, visible brushstrokes, and a limited, warm color palette dominated by greens, oranges, and yellows. There is no text or identifying information on this page, allowing the visual storytelling to take center stage.
generatedPrompts.rightInterior: Right interior page of a greeting card designed for message space with a beautifully rendered, old-fashioned scroll unfurling across the center. The scroll itself is a soft, parchment-like texture, with subtle watercolor shading that gives it depth. The text, "Jessica Greenwalt, thank you so much for attending the AI for Good Conference! Your presence helped make the conversation about as epic as a paper-craft dinosaur successfully operating a printer. We hope you left inspired and with slightly fewer paper jams in your life!", is elegantly printed on the scroll in a warm, sepia-toned, flowing script typography. The entire message area is framed by a stylized, decorative border that mimics flowing ribbons or stylized scrolls, rendered in the same warm, sepia watercolor tones. This border extends inwards, creating a sense of depth and visual interest without overwhelming the message space. The overall color palette is dominated by warm, earthy browns, creamy beiges, and hints of golden ochre, evoking a sophisticated and slightly vintage feel. The artistic style is that of a soft, painterly watercolor illustration, with visible brushstrokes and a gentle blend of colors, creating a warm and inviting atmosphere. There is no specific space designated for handwritten messages; the entire central area is occupied by the printed message, making it a focal point.
